info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 01 at 8:12PM EDT until August 01 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WARRICK AND EAST CENTRAL VANDERBURGH COUNTIES... At 712 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Newburgh, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Evansville, Newburgh and Chandler. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 1 and 12. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
